prompt: <description>**CAD Modeling Instructions** **Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Tapered Middle Section** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with 0° rotation about the X, Y, and Z axes, and a translation vector of (0, 0, 0). For the sketch, create a circle on face 1 with a center at (0.0469, 0.0469) and a radius of 0.0469. Extrude this sketch by 0.025 units in the positive Z direction, creating a new solid body. The dimensions of this part are approximately 0.094 x 0.094 x 0.025 units. **Part 2: Tapered Cylindrical Object** Create a new coordinate system at (0.0156, 0.0156, 0) with 0° rotation about the X, Y, and Z axes. For the sketch, create a circle on face 1 with a center at (0.0312, 0.0312) and a radius of 0.0312. Extrude this sketch by 0.625 units in the positive Z direction, creating a new solid body. The dimensions of this part are approximately 0.063 x 0.063 x 0.625 units. **Part 3: Rectangular Prism with Curved Side** Create a new coordinate system at (0.0344, 0.0344, 0.625) with 0° rotation about the X, Y, and Z axes. For the sketch, create a rectangle on face 1 with vertices at (0, 0), (0.025, 0), (0.025, 0.025), and (0, 0.025). Additionally, create a circle with a center at the midpoint of the segment connecting the points (0, 0.0125) and (0.025, 0.0125), and a radius of 0.0125. Extrude this sketch by 0.125 units in the positive Z direction, creating a new solid body. The dimensions of this part are approximately 0.025 x 0.025 x 0.125 units. **Part 4: Tapered Cylindrical Object** Create a new coordinate system at (0.0375, 0.0562, 0) with 0° rotation about the X and Y axes and 180° rotation about the Z axis. For the sketch, create a circle on face 1 with a center at (0.0094, 0.0094) and a radius of 0.0094. Extrude this sketch by 0.765 units in the negative Z direction, creating a new solid body. The dimensions of this part are approximately 0.019 x 0.019 x 0.765 units. After combining all the parts, the final CAD model will resemble a metallic rod or tube with a tapered end.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1 Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin with no rotation or translation. For the sketch, create face_1 and a single loop_1. For loop\\_1, create line\\_1 from (0,0) to (0.75,0), line\\_2 from (0.75,0) to (0.75,0.7), line\\_3 from (0.75,0.7) to (0,0.7), and line\\_4 from (0,0.7) to (0,0). This will create a rectangle on the XY plane. Extrude the sketch along the normal by 0.43 units, maintaining a scale factor of 0.75. Operation is to create a new solid body. Part 2 Construct a cylindrical object with flat top and bottom, connected by cylindrical tube, composed of two cylinders and a flat surface, symmetrical along vertical axis. Create a new coordinate system rotated -90 degrees about Z axis at (0.0225,0,0.0225). For the sketch, create face_1, face_2, face_3, and face_4 each with a single loop_1. Each loop_1 has a circle_1 with center at (0.0075,0.0575), (0.0075,0.3775), (0.5775,0.0075), and (0.6975,0.3775) respectively, all with radius 0.0075. Extrude the sketch with no depth in the direction of the normal and 0.05 units in the opposite direction. Scale factor remains 0.705. Operation is to cut existing material. Part 3 Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom. The cylinder has a slightly tapered shape, narrowing slightly towards the bottom. The top and bottom edges are sharp and straight. Create a new coordinate system at the origin with no rotation. Translate it to (0.025,0.05,0.43). For the sketch, create face_1 and a single loop_1. For loop_1, create circle_1 with center at (0.3,0.3) and radius 0.3. Extrude the sketch with no depth in the direction of the normal and 0.015 units in the opposite direction. Scale factor remains 0.6. Operation is to cut existing material. Note: All measurements are given in the same unit system.</description>
